issue.title: Multimap serializer doesn't work with non-String keys, even if it seems like they should.
issue.body:
Serializing a Multimap<K, ?> fails if K is any non-String type, even if intuitively it should work (e.g. K is a string-like type such as Enum, or K has an `@JsonValue` annotation).

I couldn't figure out how this is supposed to work, so I have included failing test cases for both the 1.9 branch and 2.x branch and hope that someone else who knows more about how Jackson's typing works can help out.

body: It would be nice that when this support appears, we check that it works with jackson-datatype-guava for Multimap keys.  (See the issue linked immediately previous to this comment.)

Agreed.

If anyone has cycles to add a "failing" test (one that resides under "src/test/java/.../failing, and configured to be by-passed for regular build) that would be appreciated.

issue.title: jakson @JsonValue on an enum field, when this enum used as map key

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

issue.body:
Hi there, I found out this issue;

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22023377/jakson-jsonvalue-on-an-enum-field-when-this-enum-used-as-map-key

issue.title: Serialisation of enums with Jackson

repository.name: jsonschema2pojo
repository.description: Generate Java types from JSON or JSON Schema and annotate those types for data-binding with Jackson, Gson, etc

issue.body:
I encountered a problem with the serialisation of enums with Jackson.
If I define an enum like this:

``` json
                    "berufsgruppe": {
                        "id": "person/berufsgruppe",
                        "type": "string",
                        "required": false,
                        "enum": [
                                                        ...
                            "Geringfügig Beschäftigte",
                                                        ...
                        ]
```

The generated Java enum looks like that:

``` java
    @Generated("org.jsonschema2pojo")
    public static enum Berufsgruppe {
                 ...
        GERINGFÜGIG_BESCHÄFTIGTE("Geringfügig Beschäftigte"),
                 ...
        }
```

I did expect, that the Json that is generated using the ObjectMapper would like like this:

```
...,"berufsgruppe":"Geringfügig Beschäftigte",...
```

but it looks like this:

```
...,"berufsgruppe":"GERINGFÜGIG_BESCHÄFTIGTE",...
```

What do I need to do to get the correct Json?

body: Finally went back. Not very difficult to do. Still need to see guava side.

issue.title: Allow use of `@JsonValue` for "key serializers"

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: Duplicate of an existing (usually earlier) issue

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

issue.body:
Currently custom key serializers are needed for most types beyond Enums, primitives, and things for which datatype library exists to add support.

But one seemingly easy additional case would be allowing use of `@JsonValue` annotated accessor for class, if any found.

issue.title: Add `@JsonKey` annotation (similar to `@JsonValue`) for customizable serialization of Map keys

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Issue that seems easy to resolve and is likely a good candidate for contributors new to project
